Dear Member:
One of the most rewarding fields In which the Academy
Is active is our Speakers Bureau. Each year requests are
received for speakers, lecturers and advisers to make the
world of television more meaningful to the public. These
engagements are filled by members of the Academy, and you
are invited to participate in this exciting work which
benefits not only the public and the industry, but the
Academy itself.
If you wish to offer your services as a speaker,
lecturer or adviser, please fill out the enclosed ques¬
tionnaire and return it in the enclosed envelope. At a
later date you will be asked to meet with a member of the
Speakers Bureau Committee so that we may know how best to
use your abilities in the Bureau's work.
All travel and maintenance expenses are paid for our
volunteers by the organization they serve. Since each
Chapter serves its own geographic area, a journey of more
than an hour or two is rarely required.
All arrangements for engagements you may wish to fill
will be made in consultation with you and at your conven¬
ience. If you have any questions, please contact Kenneth
Leedom at the Academy in New York.
Thank you for your interest and cooperation.
Sincerely,
ACADEMY OP TELEVISION ARTS AND SCIENCES
Charles Mountain, Chairman
New York Speakers Bureau
